author: sussman
msg: Solutions for tricky problems:  what happens if you get a property
conflict on 'svn:eol-style' during an update?  And how do we make sure
calls to svn_wc_text_modified_p are always using the "correct"
eol-style during the update?
* get_editor.c (close_file): Remove redundant call to
svn_wc_text_modified_p.  Do property merge in the beginning, and
notice if svn:eol-style was in a state of conflict, and possibly set
the property early on.  This affects the correct choice of which
eol-style to use when doing textual merges, and also whether the
call to svn_text_modified_p will find the 'latest' eol-style or not.
(struct file_baton): add eol value field.
(change_file_prop):  fill in new eol value field.
(close_directory):  update call to svn_wc__do_property_merge.
* props.c (svn_wc__do_property_merge): new feature -- return a hash of
conflicts, if any occurred.
* wc.h (svn_wc__do_property_merge): update declaration.

author: kfogel
msg: Doc changes made while researching another [upcoming] change:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/wc.h (svn_wc__get_eol_style): Make doc string a
bit more specific.
(svn_wc__files_contents_same_p): Add note about why this isn't in the
io library.

author: cmpilato
msg: * subversion/tests/libsvn_subr/subst-test.c
(substitute_and_verify): Minor comment edit.  Fixed Line 24 and Line
50 cases.  Added handling for Line 30 case.

author: rooneg
msg: Error out if the configured diff program no longer exists.  In the process,
consolidate the code calling diff, which was replicated in several places.
This closes issue #596
* subversion/includes/svn_error_codes.h
(SVN_ERR_EXTERNAL_PROGRAM): new error type for when an external
program fails in an unexpected way.
* subversion/include/svn_io.h
(svn_io_run_diff): new prototype.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/get_editor.c
(close_file): use svn_io_run_diff instead of calling diff by hand.
* subversion/libsvn_subr/io.c
(svn_io_run_diff): new function that calls diff (via svn_io_run_cmd),
so we don't have to reproduce the logic all over the place.  most of
this logic comes from libsvn_client/diff.c
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(svn_client__diff_cmd): use svn_io_run_diff instead of calling diff
by hand.
* subversion/svnlook/main.c
(print_diff_tree): ditto.
Approved By: gstein

author: sussman
msg: New EOL logic for commits.  Again, don't go turning on svn:eol-style
properties just yet.
* adm_crawler.c (do_postfix_text_deltas):  when committing a file, if
the eol-style is 'native' or 'fixed', then make a translated (to LF
or specific fixed-style, respectively) copy in .svn/tmp/.  Commit
that.
* log.c (replace_text_base): in post-commit processing, if the
eol-style is 'fixed', then copy the committed tmpfile back on top of
working with specific fixed-style eol translation.  We do this
because mixed-styles may have been "repaired" when creating
the tmpfile.  Therefore we want the working file to reflect what was
actually committed.
